trans-unit.source: Configures ASP.NET profiles that determine how health-monitoring events are sent to event providers.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class corresponds to the `<healthMonitoring>` configuration file element.
Medium trust or higher is required to raise an event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection"></xref> class using default settings.
This constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.
Setting
Default value
Gets a collection of objects that specify the settings for the buffer modes.
This is a collection of <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects that define the manner in which health-monitoring events can be buffered before they are raised.
This property defaults to an empty <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModesCollection> collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModesCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether health monitoring is enabled.
`true` if health monitoring is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.EventMappingSettingsCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.EventMappingSettings"></xref> objects.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.EventMappingSettingsCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.EventMappingSettings"></xref> objects.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.EventMappingSettingsCollection"></xref> collection.
Gets or sets the interval used by the application domain when it raises the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebHeartbeatEvent"></xref> event.
If the <xref:System.TimeSpan> value is zero ticks, no <xref:System.Web.Management.WebHeartbeatEvent> event is raised.
The interval used by the application domain when it raises the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebHeartbeatEvent"></xref> event.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettingsCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> objects.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettingsCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> objects.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettingsCollection"></xref> collection.
Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettings"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> property specifies which provider is used for which of the events defined in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.EventMappings%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> collection.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> collection.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettingsCollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings"></xref> objects.

Each <xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings> object defines a connection between an event defined in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.EventMappings%2A> property and an event provider defined in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettingsCollection"></xref> collection.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettingsCollection"></xref> collection
